FullDescription: Vantify Risk Manager is a market-leading compliance and risk management system designed by safety experts specifically for safety and property management professionals. It replaces manual processes and disparate systems with an intelligent, intuitive platform optimized for multi-site applications. The system provides holistic visibility of health, safety, and environmental compliance across your entire organization through real-time dashboards, automated workflows, and comprehensive reporting. It seamlessly integrates with existing systems and the broader Vantify ecosystem.
Video60SecScript: Vantify Risk Manager gives you one clear view of all your compliance activities. Instead of spreadsheets and emails, everything - risks, actions, documents, deadlines - lives in one intuitive platform. The result? You always know where you stand, auditors love the evidence, and your team saves hours every week.
KeyFeature1: Real-time compliance dashboard with dynamic data grids and charts for instant visibility across multiple sites
KeyFeature2: Automated document tracking, action management, and email notifications with date-stamped audit trail
KeyFeature3: Fully customizable automated reporting with performance monitoring dashboards
TargetUsers: Property managers; Facility managers; Health & safety professionals; Compliance officers; Risk managers; Operations directors
CustomerQuote: I'm not aware of any other health and safety platforms that offer the same level of flexibility. Not only does it track documentation, but it also allows for the creation of dynamic actions based on that documentation. - Grace Morgan, CompassRock
CommonUseCase: Multi-site property portfolios requiring centralized compliance tracking; Organizations needing robust audit trails and defensibility; Property managers in commercial/residential, education, healthcare, and local authority sectors requiring real-time visibility across 50+ locations and multiple stakeholders
IntegrationsWith: Other Vantify products (CAFM, Supply Chain, Intelligence); HR systems; Client systems; Mobile apps; Insurers certificates; Risk surveys; 3rd party contractor portals
StillNeeded: Pricing tiers, Typical implementation time 4 weeks

FullDescription: Vantify CAFM is a property-based facilities management (FM) system designed to simplify and automate everyday FM processes. Particularly powerful for large-scale operations across property management and multi-site environments, helping teams delegate work through the supply chain with very little admin effort. It can also be delivered as a fully managed service, including 24/7 helpdesk, requiring almost no system management from the client.
Video60SecScript: Managing properties shouldn't mean drowning in spreadsheets. Vantify CAFM gives you complete visibility - every asset, every contractor, every job - in one system backed by our 24/7 UK service desk. Most clients say they save 10+ hours per week in admin time alone.
KeyFeature1: Tenant CRM with mass communications, site visit booking, and template emails integrated with property management
KeyFeature2: Full CMMS functionality with asset registers, PPM scheduling, service history tracking, and visual PPM planner to identify gaps
KeyFeature3: Real-time reactive jobs workflow with automation, supply chain delegation, and unique "Update SLA" for operative communication
TargetUsers: Property managers; Facilities managers; Estate managers; Asset managers; Service providers; Maintenance teams; Operations directors; Sustainability managers
CustomerQuote: The integration has allowed us to establish a cohesive ecosystem, facilitating enhanced visibility, improved efficiency, and streamlined processes. - Client testimonial
CommonUseCase: Multi-site property portfolios requiring comprehensive facilities management; Property managers needing to delegate work to supply chain; Organizations requiring cost benchmarking across multiple service providers; Shopping centres needing patrols and compliance tracking; Property managers seeking 24/7 helpdesk support with minimal internal administration
IntegrationsWith: Vantify Risk Manager, Vantify Supply Chain, External CAFM tools; Works in tandem with property/lease management systems; Document repositories; Energy consultants (meter readings); Billing systems; Mobile apps for reactive jobs and PPM

FullDescription: Vantify Supply Chain gives businesses clear visibility, control, and actionable insights across their supplier networks. It supports the full supplier lifecycle, from onboarding to contract completion, helping organizations manage and optimize relationships with suppliers, contractors, and service providers. The platform combines supplier qualification and compliance, KPI/SLA performance monitoring, real-time alerts, and integrated financial health checks powered by Red Flag Alert. With a modern design and its unrivalled customizability, it enables bespoke question sets, SSIP compliance, and tailored assessments, while providing instant access to thousands of trusted providers across the UK and worldwide.
Video60SecScript: Take control of your supply chain with complete visibility over suppliers and contractors. From onboarding to performance tracking, ensure every supplier meets your standards. Real-time compliance monitoring and risk mitigation built-in. Used by property managers across the UK to simplify contractor management.
KeyFeature1: End-to-end supplier management from onboarding through contract completion with centralized visibility and control
KeyFeature2: Service provider performance monitoring against KPIs and SLAs with automated tracking and accountability reporting
KeyFeature3: Real-time alerts and updates on supplier status, compliance changes, and potential risks for proactive management
TargetUsers: Property managers; Facilities managers; Procurement managers; Supply chain managers; Compliance officers; Contract managers; Operations directors; Risk managers
CustomerQuote: Vantify Supply Chain provides an intuitive platform to efficiently manage and optimize your network of suppliers and contractors. - Steve Pearson, BPL Property

FullDescription: Omnitrack is a flexible, no-code compliance workflow automation platform that helps organizations collect, track, and manage compliance data efficiently. It automates compliance processes end to end, embedding regulatory best practice from bodies such as the ICO, HSE, FCA, SRA, LSAG, and GDPR. Administrators can quickly update forms, logic, routing, and workflows without IT support, while maintaining audit-ready reporting and a single source of truth for compliance activity. The platform scales from simple forms to enterprise-grade workflows, replaces email and Excel with automated routing, approvals, and full audit trails, and supports integrations via an open REST API. Best-practice templates are provided and fully customizable, helping organizations reduce manual effort, improve scalability, and lower regulatory risk.
Video60SecScript: Complex compliance workflows shouldn't require developers. Omnitrack provides no-code tools for gifts & hospitality, conflicts of interest, GDPR processes, and more. Build workflows, track declarations, get reports - all without writing code. Used by leading financial and legal firms.
KeyFeature1: No-code workflow automation with rapid form, logic, routing, and threshold changes without IT involvement, enabling instant compliance process modifications
KeyFeature2: Embedded regulatory best practice templates from ICO, HSE, SRA, FCA, LSAG, GDPR providing compliance frameworks that are 100% customizable to specific needs
KeyFeature3: End-to-end compliance automation replacing email and Excel with automated routing, approvals, reminders, comprehensive audit trails, and centralized data visibility
TargetUsers: Compliance officers; Risk managers; Legal teams; Operations managers; MLRO; Data protection officers; Procurement managers; HR managers; Audit teams
CommonUseCase: Companies needing automated routing and approvals for compliance workflows; Businesses requiring audit-ready reporting and comprehensive audit trails; Companies with rigid legacy systems that can't adapt to changing requirements; Multi-team operations needing scalable compliance processes; Organizations preparing for regulatory audits requiring evidence of oversight
IntegrationsWith: Open REST API for custom integrations; Astute LMS (training compliance connection); VinciWorks eLearning (workflow triggers training); HR systems; Document management systems; Reporting and BI tools; Third-party compliance systems

FullDescription: Regulatory Intelligence is an EHS compliance platform providing legislation, guidance, standards, and trade publications in one place. Users get instant access to up-to-date legislation from the HSE, Environment Agency, and other government bodies, alongside British and Irish standards. The platform includes ready-made templates, toolbox talks, videos, briefings, factsheets, model policies, training tools, risk assessments, ISO gap analysis tools (14001, 45001, 45003, 50001), case law, and weekly news updates. It also features a legal register builder, horizon scanning, legislation summaries, and Barbour guides. Modular subscriptions allow focus on topics such as Health & Safety, Environment & Energy, Fire, Property, International Service, and Mental Health & Wellbeing, with bookmarkable documents and email alerts for regulatory changes.

FullDescription: EU Representative (Article 27) Service enables non-EU organizations to meet GDPR requirements when processing the personal data of EU data subjects. The service provides representation across all 27 EU member states, managing regulatory liaison, responding to data subject inquiries, and maintaining required GDPR documentation on the organization’s behalf. Coverage can be tailored to a single country, multiple jurisdictions, or full EU-wide representation, depending on operational needs. The service is essential for non-EU SaaS companies, e-commerce platforms, technology companies, healthcare providers, and financial services firms that process EU personal data.

FullDescription: UK Representative (Article 27) Service enables non-UK organizations to meet UK GDPR requirements when processing the personal data of UK data subjects. The service provides UK representation by managing regulatory liaison with the ICO, responding to data subject inquiries, and maintaining required UK GDPR documentation on the organization’s behalf. Following Brexit, UK representation is separate from EU representation, meaning organizations that process both UK and EU personal data must appoint both a UK and an EU representative. The service is essential for non-UK SaaS companies, e-commerce platforms, technology companies, healthcare providers, and financial services firms that process UK personal data.
